# Drone News 48h Brief — February 19, 2026

_Window: last 48 hours; 60 incidents._

## Summary
In the past 48 hours, multiple incidents involving drones have emerged across various regions. Reports reveal that prisons are struggling to counter the influx of drones delivering contraband, notably drugs, posing significant challenges to security. In Lebanon, US personnel responded assertively to a drone crash at a military base, highlighting geopolitical tensions. In Sudan, drone strikes have raised alarms for civilians with reports of civilian casualties and compromised humanitarian aid. South Korea is revisiting its no-fly zones amid concerns over civilian drone incursions into North Korean airspace as countermeasures to unauthorized drone activities intensify globally, especially concerning threats from drug cartels. This surge emphasizes the evolving role of drones in smuggling, security breaches, and the enforcement of international borders.

**By category:** airport: 2 • arrest: 16 • crash: 4 • interference: 1 • other: 24 • security: 3 • smuggling: 7 • terrorism: 3
**Top queries:** drone arrest (18), unauthorized drone (14), drone incident (10), drone smuggling (5), drone terrorism (4)
